Topic: Draw animals in their habitats with labels (e.g., fish in water).
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can accurately draw a variety of plants and animals, including humans, and label them clearly.
The student can illustrate and label different habitats where these plants and animals live, such as fish in the water and deer in the forest.
The student can depict essential resources such as water for fish and sunlight for plants and label them in the drawing.
The student can show and label some relationships indicating needs, like plants needing sunlight or fish needing water.
The student can demonstrate and label the interconnections between specific plants and animals and their habitats, showing a basic understanding of these relationships.
CANNOT: The student may inconsistently label all components or leave out some less obvious needs, like air *(student overlooks air as a necessary element)*.

The student might not fully depict or label how plants, animals, their habitats, and their resources work together as parts of a system, missing some interactions *(student has partial understanding of ecological systems)*.
The student could inaccurately label or misrepresent some relationships, such as showing fish needing sunlight directly *(misunderstands specific needs of animals)*.
The student might occasionally forget to label some parts of the drawing or use inconsistent labeling conventions *(inconsistent application of skills; forgets to label all parts)*.
